metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5356 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Irssi before 0.8.21 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and crash) via a string containing a formatting sequence (%[) without a closing bracket (]).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5356` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

irssi - 0.8.15-5ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: irssi package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.8.15-5ubuntu3.1').
